meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>suspend</kanji>, but in this case, you're going to suspend your win or loss and try <vocabulary>to stake</vocabulary> it all on one, big bet. You're going <vocabulary>to risk</vocabulary> it all!
readingMnemonic: You decide <vocabulary>to risk</vocabulary> it all and bet everything on your <reading>ca</reading>r (か). If you lose, you lose the car, but if you win, then you were right to stake it all on this.
